## Public Member Functions

### EmitInstrWithCustomInserter() {#a13afdeda523046ab7176bead48d1c46f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineBasicBlock &#42; XCoreTargetLowering::EmitInstrWithCustomInserter (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; MBB) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method should be implemented by targets that mark instructions with the &#39;usesCustomInserter&#39; flag.

These instructions are special in various ways, which require special support to insert. The specified <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> is created but not inserted into any basic blocks, and this method is called to expand it into a sequence of instructions, potentially also creating new basic blocks and control flow. As long as the returned basic block is different (i.e., we created a new one), the custom inserter is free to modify the rest of <code>MBB</code>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/xcore/xcoreisellowering-h/#l00117">117</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/xcore/xcoreisellowering-h">XCoreISelLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/xcore/xcoreisellowering-cpp/#l01426">1426</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/xcore/xcoreisellowering-cpp">XCoreISelLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
If a physical register, this returns the register that receives the exception address on entry to an EH pad.

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Given a physical register constraint (e.g.

&#123;edx&#125;), return the register number and the register class for the register.

Given a register class constraint, like &#39;r&#39;, if this corresponds directly to an LLVM register class, return a register of 0 and the register class pointer.

This should only be used for C&#95;Register constraints. On error, this returns a register number of 0 and a null register class pointer.

### PerformDAGCombine() {#aa30f72082fce3967a6bf22f91849d251}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue XCoreTargetLowering::PerformDAGCombine (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; N, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/targetlowering/dagcombinerinfo">DAGCombinerInfo</a> &amp; DCI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method will be invoked for all target nodes and for any target-independent nodes that the target has registered with invoke it for.

The semantics are as follows: Return <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>: SDValue.Val == 0 - No change was made SDValue.Val == N - N was replaced, is dead, and is already handled. otherwise - N should be replaced by the returned Operand.

In addition, methods provided by <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/targetlowering/dagcombinerinfo">DAGCombinerInfo</a> may be used to perform more complex transformations.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/xcore/xcoreisellowering-h/#l00194">194</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/xcore/xcoreisellowering-h">XCoreISelLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/xcore/xcoreisellowering-cpp/#l01492">1492</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/xcore/xcoreisellowering-cpp">XCoreISelLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
